Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hylin-Pul1 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, the tree frog,Boana pulchella, South America

Literature.Author: Aguilar S, Brunetti AE, Garay AV, Santos LC, Perez LO, Moreira D, Cancelarich L, Barbosa EA, Basso NG, de Freitas SM, Faivovich J, Brand G, Cabrera GM, Leite JRSA, Marani MM. 2022
Literature.Title: Structure and function of cationic hylin bioactive peptides from the tree frog Boana pulchella in interaction with lipid membranes.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (75%) toHylin b2I=L=G=21%. GRAVY: 1.46; mol wt: 1909.352: Mol formula: C90H154N22O22; Mol ex Coeff: 0.Activity: weakly active against E.coli (MIC 102 uM) and S.aureus (MIC 102 uM).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in lipid vesicles, especially anionic DMPG.
